text: The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after he died—his ashes were molded into one! Scotland has 421 words for "snow," including "sneesl" (to start snowing) and "skelf" (a large snowflake). Sloths can take up to a month to digest a single leaf due to their slow metabolism. Pigeons can tell the difference between paintings by Picasso and Monet. There's a species of jellyfish that is biologically immortal and can revert to its juvenile state after maturing. Cats can't taste sweetness, which might explain why they're not interested in your desserts. In Switzerland, it's illegal to own just one guinea pig because they get lonely—they must be kept in pairs.

A shrimp's heart is located in its head. Turtles can breathe through their butts, a process called "cloacal respiration." Elephants are the only animals that can't jump, but they can sleep standing up. Wombats are the only animals whose poop is cube-shaped, and scientists believe this helps mark their territory. Kangaroos can't walk backward due to their muscular tails. The word "astronaut" comes from the Greek words for "star" and "sailor," meaning "star sailor." There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones! The longest hiccuping spree lasted for 68 years, by Charles Osborne. Ducks' quacks don't echo, and no one knows why. You can hear a blue whale's heartbeat from over 2 miles away.
